niche.tagline: Heal through food ‚Äî the way nature intended

method.name: W.H.O.L.E. Method‚Ñ¢
method.fullTitle: The W.H.O.L.E. Method‚Ñ¢ for Holistic Nutrition
method.description: A food-first, whole-person approach to nutrition that goes beyond calories and macros. The W.H.O.L.E. Method addresses the emotional, environmental, and energetic aspects of eating ‚Äî because what you eat is only half the story.

steps.title: Witness the Patterns
steps.description: Observe the client's full food relationship ‚Äî not just what they eat, but when, why, how, and with whom. Map emotional triggers and unconscious patterns.

steps.title: Heal the Relationship
steps.description: Address food shame, diet culture damage, and disordered eating patterns before introducing any nutritional changes.

steps.title: Optimize with Whole Foods
steps.description: Build a personalized nutrition plan centered on nutrient-dense, whole foods that support the client's unique biochemistry and health goals.

steps.title: Listen to the Body
steps.description: Teach intuitive eating principles ‚Äî helping clients reconnect with hunger, satiety, and the body's innate wisdom about what it needs.

steps.title: Elevate the Lifestyle
steps.description: Integrate nutrition into the broader lifestyle: sleep, movement, stress management, and environment. Food doesn't work in isolation.

examQuestions.question: What does 'bio-individuality' mean in holistic nutrition?
options: Everyone should eat the same diet
Each person has unique nutritional needs based on their biochemistry
examQuestions.explanation: Bio-individuality recognizes that each person has unique nutritional needs based on their genetics, gut health, lifestyle, and biochemistry ‚Äî meaning no single diet works for everyone.

examQuestions.question: What does the 'H' in the W.H.O.L.E. Method‚Ñ¢ stand for?
examQuestions.explanation: The 'H' stands for 'Heal the Relationship' ‚Äî addressing food shame, diet culture damage, and disordered patterns before introducing nutritional changes.

examQuestions.question: Why should holistic nutritionists address food shame before changing diets?
options: Because diet changes won't stick if the underlying emotional relationship with food is damaged
examQuestions.explanation: When clients carry food shame and diet culture trauma, any new nutritional plan becomes another 'diet' to resist or fail at. Healing the relationship first creates the foundation for sustainable change.

examQuestions.question: What is intuitive eating?
options: Reconnecting with the body's natural hunger and satiety signals to guide food choices
examQuestions.explanation: Intuitive eating is a practice of reconnecting with the body's innate hunger and fullness cues, removing the need for external food rules while promoting a healthy relationship with eating.

examQuestions.question: In the W.H.O.L.E. Method‚Ñ¢, why does the 'Elevate' step integrate nutrition with lifestyle?
options: Because food doesn't work in isolation ‚Äî sleep, stress, and environment all affect nutritional outcomes
examQuestions.explanation: Nutrition is deeply interconnected with sleep quality, stress levels, movement, and environment. The 'Elevate' step recognizes that optimizing food alone is insufficient for lasting health.

zombie.name: Marissa
zombie.backstory: Former corporate marketing manager who spent 15 years battling her weight with every diet imaginable ‚Äî keto, Whole30, calorie counting, intermittent fasting. Nothing stuck until she discovered holistic nutrition.
zombie.transformation: After healing her own food relationship, Marissa got certified and now specializes in helping women recover from diet culture and build sustainable nutrition habits using the W.H.O.L.E. Method‚Ñ¢.
zombie.incomeStory: Marissa earns $4,900/month coaching women through food freedom programs. She quit her corporate job 8 months ago and has a 4-week waitlist.
zombie.writingStyle: Warm, encouraging, anti-diet culture warrior. Uses food emojis freely. Very relatable about her own struggles. Loves a good recipe share.

faq.q: Do I need a dietetics degree?
faq.a: No. Holistic nutrition focuses on whole-food guidance and lifestyle coaching ‚Äî not medical nutrition therapy. Many successful holistic nutritionists have no formal nutrition background.
Yes ‚Äî this training is rooted in anti-diet, weight-inclusive principles. We focus on nourishment and food relationship healing, not restriction or calorie counting.

faq.q: Can I create meal plans for clients?
faq.a: The scope depends on your state/country. We teach you exactly what's within scope and when to refer to registered dietitians.

sarah.credentials: Holistic Nutrition Specialist & Food Relationship Expert
sarah.storySnippet: After watching thousands of women cycle through diet after diet, I developed the W.H.O.L.E. Method‚Ñ¢ ‚Äî because I realized the problem was never about the food. It was about the relationship with food.

buyerPersona.demographics: Women 28-50, often with personal diet/food relationship struggles, health-conscious but disillusioned with diet culture
buyerPersona.psychographics: Anti-diet, whole-food focused, want to combine passion for food with helping others. Often recovering from their own food struggles.
